intro: Mimosa fernandez-casasii, commonly known as the Fernández-Casasii mimosa, is a rare and delicate plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its feathery, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
